docs.snippet: Some 21 percent of the top lawyers at the nation’s Fortune 500 companies are women, an increase from 17 percent five years ago, according to a new tally of corporate counsel ranks....

headline.main: Women Lawyers Climb Top Rungs of Corporate America

docs.abstract: Some 21 percent of the top lawyers at the nation’s Fortune 500 companies are women, an increase from 17 percent five years ago, according to a new tally of corporate counsel ranks.

docs.snippet: U.S. Labor Secretary Tom Perez offered details this week about the Obama administration's push to revise overtime pay regulations, confirming the Labor Department may close a "loophole" in the test used to determine which workers are managers....

headline.main: U.S. Labor's Perez Details Obama's Overtime Rules Overhaul
headline.print_headline: U.S. Labor's Perez Details Obama's Overtime Rules Overhaul

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. Labor Secretary Tom Perez offered details this week about the Obama administration's push to revise overtime pay regulations, confirming the Labor Department may close a "loophole" in the test used to determine which workers are managers.

docs.snippet: Oracle said Tuesday its fiscal third-quarter net income rose 2 percent, helped by higher cloud software subscription revenue, but investors wanted more growth and the company's stock fell in late trading....

headline.main: Oracle Fiscal 3Q Net Income Rises 2 Pct
headline.print_headline: Oracle Fiscal 3Q Net Income Rises 2 Pct

docs.lead_paragraph: Oracle said Tuesday its fiscal third-quarter net income rose 2 percent, helped by higher cloud software subscription revenue, but investors wanted more growth and the company's stock fell in late trading.

docs.snippet: Exchange operator IntercontinentalExchange Group more than doubled the total compensation of its chief executive, Jeffrey Sprecher, last year to just under $18 million, according to a regulatory filing....

headline.main: ICE More Than Doubled CEO's Pay to Nearly $18 Million in 2013
headline.print_headline: ICE More Than Doubled CEO's Pay to Nearly $18 Million in 2013

docs.lead_paragraph: Exchange operator IntercontinentalExchange Group more than doubled the total compensation of its chief executive, Jeffrey Sprecher, last year to just under $18 million, according to a regulatory filing.

docs.snippet: A U.S. lawyer on Tuesday appealed a federal judge's ruling that he used fraud to secure a multibillion-dollar pollution judgment against Chevron Corp in Ecuador, a decision that bars him from collecting a $9.5 billion award in the United States....

headline.main: Lawyer Appeals Ruling That Blocks U.S. Collection of Award in Chevron Ecuador Case
headline.print_headline: Lawyer Appeals Ruling That Blocks U.S. Collection of Award in Chevron Ecuador Case

docs.lead_paragraph: A U.S. lawyer on Tuesday appealed a federal judge's ruling that he used fraud to secure a multibillion-dollar pollution judgment against Chevron Corp in Ecuador, a decision that bars him from collecting a $9.5 billion award in the United States.

docs.snippet: A review of a deadly shooting that killed a federal security officer at Los Angeles International Airport in November faulted law enforcement agencies for communication lapses during the initial response, a report showed on Tuesday....

headline.main: Report Faults Police Response to Los Angeles Airport Shooting
headline.print_headline: Report Faults Police Response to Los Angeles Airport Shooting

docs.lead_paragraph: A review of a deadly shooting that killed a federal security officer at Los Angeles International Airport in November faulted law enforcement agencies for communication lapses during the initial response, a report showed on Tuesday.

docs.snippet: An investigation now unfolding in Utah exposes how the non-profit system can be corrupted for the benefit of a single politician, and a single industry....
docs.abstract: An investigation now unfolding in Utah exposes how the non-profit system can be corrupted for the benefit of a single politician, and a single industry.

docs.snippet: The day’s top showbiz news and headlines including the Rolling Stones cancel their concerts following L’Wren Scott’s death, Kanye West is placed on two-year probation....

headline.sub: Rolling Stones cancel concerts; Kanye West gets probation

docs.lead_paragraph: The day’s top showbiz news and headlines including the Rolling Stones cancel their concerts following L’Wren Scott’s death, Kanye West is placed on two-year probation.

docs.snippet: Giancarlo Stanton hit a three-run homer in the first inning that bounced on the roof of Miami's clubhouse beyond the left-field wall during the Marlins' 8-1 win over the Houston Astros on Tuesday....

headline.main: Stanton Hits Long Homer; Marlins Beat Astros 8-1
headline.print_headline: Stanton Hits Long Homer; Marlins Beat Astros 8-1

docs.lead_paragraph: Giancarlo Stanton hit a three-run homer in the first inning that bounced on the roof of Miami's clubhouse beyond the left-field wall during the Marlins' 8-1 win over the Houston Astros on Tuesday.
